name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Ruby's Inn

reviews.text: Initially thought it would be a bit 'resorty' but were happily disproved. Great service throughout. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Good shop/grocers/souvenirs on site.
reviews.title: Good lodgings, good food

reviews.text: On site restaurant was excellent when ordering off the menu. Didn't try the buffet, but it looked good. Would recommend the prime rib - amazing piece of beef - and good value.
reviews.title: Main Lodge Double Pooside room was fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy reach of the National Park. A very enjoyable experience, we would go back.
reviews.title: Needs some help

reviews.text: As we were too early to stay in Bryce Lodge in the park (opens 4/1 every year), we chose the next nicest property in close proximity. My kids were very excited to see the big pool right across the hall from our room. It is nice in that it is enclosed with two story tall glass walls, so you don't get the noise or smells of a pool in the rest of the building.
reviews.title: Wonderful lodge type atmosphere!

reviews.text: Our room was standard motel style with a tub that wouldn't drain during showers, no hair conditioner (I think we could have requested it), and a heating system that was so loud and ill functioning that I had to get up all night and adjust it to a/c even thought the outside temp was 20 degrees! It did let them know upon check out of the various issues with this room.
reviews.title: Ruby's Inn is a Loser

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is the nearest hotel to Bryce Canyon. Our room was airy and clean.
reviews.title: original hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is silent, green, and staff is very accomodate!
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.text: The restaurant is fun but a little bit expensive regarding the quality of the food.
reviews.title: Very comfy and pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel to stay for several days or for a stage!
reviews.title: Best place to stay if you are going to Bryce Canyon

likes.disliked: — It looks like an average roadside hotel, but don't let that scare you away

reviews.text: We have just returned from a tour of Southern Utah and stayed two nights at Ruby's Inn while experiencing Bryce Canyon National Park. The Inn is convenient to the Canyon and as you read the history of Ruby's you understand why.
reviews.title: The Only Place to Stay at Bryce Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to visit Bryce Canyon National Park, and this hotel is perfectly situated. We were charmed by its western frontier decor (mostly in the lobby-- the rooms were what you would find anywhere). It was very cold (15 degrees) outside when we stayed there, but it was always toasty warm inside. They kept a fire in the fireplace in the lobby (that smelled of juniper wood-- something I love about the west). There was a general store and a great restaurant (we recommend the pot roast and baked vegetables-- essentially a beef stew). They also had an indoor pool which was really pleasant, and a cross-country ski / snow shoe rental service. Oh, and they have free wireless (though it's pretty slow out there in the middle of nowhere). Everyone on the staff was so kind and polite. Our only issue was with the dry heat in the room-- we kept glasses of water by our beside! All in all, however, we felt really comfortable here and would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Such a nice place!

likes.liked: — restaurant food and general store / lobby

reviews.text: Overpriced and overrated best described this place . It is the only game in town basically, so stay there for one night and hit the road. We had two double beds ond the bath tub wouldn't turn off and the toilet flushed poorly. Think of it as a run down Motor Hotel from the 70's before decent quality chains came around.
reviews.title: over rated

reviews.text: Spent one night at Rubys (my second trip to this hotel) with my husband and children so I knew what to expect this time. Not many choices if you want to stay overnight in this area. Very large giftshop and store....nice menu in diner.
reviews.title: Interesting Place...

reviews.text: The rooms are very typical lower price motel rooms. Nothing special.... Value for the $ was not bad.
reviews.title: What a mistake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only chain hotel we choose to stay during our US trip oand the worst stay we ever had in a hotel.
reviews.title: Great Locatuion

likes.liked: — proximity to the Bryce Canyon National Park
likes.disliked: — limited menu choice in their restaurant

reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights mid Dec 07. Ruby's was probably the only place open so had the monopoly. Despite it being a sprawling motel, given the time of year and low number of guests it felt quite cozy. A lot of winter maintenance seemed to be taking place while we were there but as we were out all day it wasn't an issue. Restaurant was fine and there is a large convenience store/gift store on the premises. We had about 6 inches of snow fall one night but by the next morning the ploughs had been out and made the roads safe to travel. Hotel staff pleasant. Given it's size I would be hesitant about staying in the summer months as I imagine it would be packed full but would definitely stay again in winter. The room was big enough but typical chain feel to it - nothing that inspiring but we came to see the canyon not the hotel room so no complaints.
reviews.title: It's got what you need

reviews.text: As a few of the previous reviewers noted, the location for this complex can't be beat. It's very close to Bryce, allowing for more time to be spent at the park (plus an early rise to beat crowds, if you're traveling at a busy time of year).
reviews.title: Great Location, Average Motel

reviews.text: The truth is, I was rather disappointed. I should have read the reviews and perhaps asked for one of the newer rooms. There was nothing wrong with the rooms per se but there wasn't anything terribly nice about them either. I felt as if I was in motel anywhere, because our rooms were rather mundane and I think I was (perhaps unfairly) expecting more because we were so close to this great park. Perhaps the truth is also that there isn't a lot there and, since we'd driven over from a visit to Zion with a stay in Springdale, the hotel suffered in comparison. I suppose I'd recommend it---perhaps if I'd gone to see the rodeo and had one of the newer rooms, I'd have enjoyed it more. Having said that, I'm not sure there's a whole lot of better choices there.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adequate. Probably one of the best choices out of a very limited selection in the area, but certainly not anything out of the ordinary. Rooms were clean, but it was very much just a motor lodge. Staff was helpful and pleasant, but again, just average overall.
reviews.title: Ruby's Inn at Bryce, Utah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came back from the US Southwest and stayed at Ruby's Inn while visiting Bryce Canyon National Park. The hotel was a short dirve to the park. The room was clean, the beds were comforable and the staff was great. One bit of advise-upgrade to the rooms in the main lodge ( the upgrade was $10.00). The rooms are newer. We would defintely stay at Ruby's Inn again. If you happen to visit Bryce in the off season, like we did, Ruby's Inn will be your only choice for accomodations and meals. The restaurant was well priced for the quality of the food, which was adequate but not exceptional.
reviews.title: Positive Experience

likes.disliked: — No other restaurants other than the one in the Hotel

aka: Best Western Plus Ruby`s Hotel Bryce
description: Best Western Ruby's Inn, the closest accommodations to Bryce Canyon National Park, is the perfect base for your exploration of scenic Southern Utah. We offer the finest accommodations and amenities in the Bryce Canyon National Park region. Ruby's Inn at Bryce Canyon is a destination in and of itself. Rubys Inn has 368 Spacious Guest Rooms, 2-Bedroom Suites, Non-Smoking Rooms, Color Satellite TV, Air Conditioning, Indoor and Outdoor Swimming Pools and Spas. At Bryce Canyon you'll enjoy horseback riding, ATV and helicopter tours, along with Bryce Canyon western experiences such as chuckwagon dinners, rodeos and more. You'll also find our General Store to be the largest, including an impressive selection of authentic Southwestern Indian arts and crafts including jewelry, pottery and weavings. Open All Year!
